juice-shop.Title: Juice Shop Application
juice-shop.JustificationCiaRating: In-scope web application (contains all business logic and vulnerabilities by design).

CommunicationLinks.Title: To Challenge WebHook
CommunicationLinks.Description: Optional outbound callback (HTTP POST) to external WebHook when a challenge is solved.

persistent-storage.Title: Persistent Storage
persistent-storage.Description: Host-mounted volume for database, file uploads, and logs.
persistent-storage.JustificationCiaRating: Local disk storage for the container â€“ not directly exposed, but if compromised it contains sensitive data (database and logs).

reverse-proxy.Title: Reverse Proxy
reverse-proxy.Description: Optional reverse proxy (e.g., Nginx) for TLS termination and adding security headers.
reverse-proxy.JustificationCiaRating: Not exposed to internet directly; improves security of inbound traffic.

CommunicationLinks.Title: To App
CommunicationLinks.Description: Proxy forwarding to app (HTTP on 3000 internally).

user-browser.Title: User Browser
user-browser.JustificationCiaRating: Client controlled by end user (potentially an attacker).

CommunicationLinks.Title: To Reverse Proxy (preferred)
CommunicationLinks.Description: User browser to reverse proxy (HTTPS on 443).

CommunicationLinks.Title: Direct to App (no proxy)
CommunicationLinks.Description: Direct browser access to app (HTTP on 3000).

webhook-endpoint.Title: Webhook Endpoint
webhook-endpoint.Description: External WebHook service (3rd-party, if configured for integrations).
webhook-endpoint.JustificationOutOfScope: Third-party service to receive notifications (not under our control).
webhook-endpoint.JustificationCiaRating: External service that receives data (like order or challenge info). Treated as a trusted integration point but could be abused if misconfigured.
